Subtle tweak to the wording - "These shapes in the closure..." - to point that the sentence is referring to explicitly the listed shapes. I can foresee some reading the last part and being confused when encountering this taken from the test outputs, with one saying must and the other saying should worded to a general case:
[DANGER] another.ns#ListC: Shape name `ListC` conflicts with `ns.foo#ListC` in the `ns.foo#MyService` service closure. Shapes in the closure of a service must have case-insensitively unique names regardless of their namespaces. | Service
[NOTE] ns.foo#String: Shape name `String` conflicts with `smithy.api#String` in the `ns.foo#MyService` service closure. Shapes in the closure of a service should have case-insensitively unique names regardless of their namespaces. | Service
